definition: to give an interview/to be interviewed/to respond to (questions, a survey etc)
to receive/to accept/to suffer/subjected to/to bear/to stand/pleasant/(passive marker)
to visit/to call on/to seek/to inquire/to investigate
participant in a survey/an interviewee/those questioned

sentences.english: We can invest in clean technologies and make the shift to a clean economy with lower emissions. Switching to sustainable technologies was supported by 66 percent of the UMR poll respondents.
sentences.chinese: UMR调查的受访者66%支持转向可持续的技术。

sentences.english: The interviewer asked the interviewees their opinions on the minimum wage.
sentences.chinese: 访问员向受访人查问他们对最低工资的意见。

sentences.english: Even among those polled in the US, some 48 per cent agreed.
sentences.chinese: 即使在美国，也有大约48%的受访者同意上述说法。

sentences.english: Like all the other interviewees she refused to be named.
sentences.chinese: 想起他的受访者一样，她拒绝留下名字。

sentences.english: Was it possible that the plaintiffs had colluded with Beristain to handpick the interviewees?
sentences.chinese: 是否有可能是原告勾结贝斯坦并精心挑选了受访者？

sentences.english: Only 12 percent of respondents said that made-in-China quality was improving.
sentences.chinese: 只有12%的受访者认为“中国制造”的质量在改善。

sentences.english: Another 26 percent reported that they didn't clean cabinets.
sentences.chinese: 报告称，另外26%的受访者没有清洁他们的厨柜。

sentences.english: Results showed that 70% of respondents did not want to buy dried mushroom from China.
sentences.chinese: 结果发现，约70%受访者不愿购买大陆干香菇。

sentences.english: Respondents were quizzed on their feelings about God as a provider of control.
sentences.chinese: 受访者被问及对主宰万物的神的感觉。

sentences.english: Britons are ruder than they were a decade ago, according to a survey on Monday that showed almost three-quarters of people think manners should be taught at school.
sentences.chinese: 近四分之三的受访者认为学校应加强礼仪教育。

sentences.english: With more than 10 lenders say, their money is ultimately to Shi Guobao.
sentences.chinese: 受访的十多名放贷者称，他们的钱最终是给石国豹的。

sentences.english: Sixty-two percent of investors polled by the CAQ believe the rules mandated by Sarbanes-Oxley should be left in place.
sentences.chinese: 的受访投资者认为萨班斯法案的相关规则应保持原状。

sentences.english: All the respondent could get a GWP after the research.
sentences.chinese: 所有的受访者可以得到一个全球升温潜能的研究后。

sentences.english: The poll is based on a random sample of 1,097 respondents nationwide.
sentences.chinese: 该调查的受访者是从全国随机抽取的1097名民众。

sentences.english: Only 10% of those surveyed said they will friend anyone.
sentences.chinese: 只有10%的受访者表示他们会同任何人交友。

sentences.english: Bulgarian judges won 31 percent approval, while in Poland 86 percent said they trusted judges.
sentences.chinese: 的保加利亚受访者信任法官，而在波兰比例为86%。

definition: participant in a survey/an interviewee/those questioned
respondent (in a survey, questionnaire, study etc)
investigator
to express/to show/to say/to state/to indicate/to mean
to confess/to admit/to come clean/calmly
to speak forthrightly/to talk bluntly
opinion poll
to interview/to gather news/to hunt for and collect/to cover
to say candidly/to acknowledge frankly
Carrie Lam (1957-), chief executive of Hong Kong 2017-, full name 林鄭月娥|林郑月娥[Lin2 Zheng4 Yue4 e2] Carrie Lam Cheng Yuet-ngor
previously
(Tw) to make a telephone call (generally as a representative of a company, school or agency etc, to an individual, often for the purpose of conducting a survey) (abbr. for 電話訪問|电话访问)
to visit and discuss/to interview
William Lai Ching-te (1959-), Taiwanese DPP politician, vice president of the Republic of China from 2020
Taiwan media
results (of an investigation, poll)
